title: NESsT and Citi Announce Winner of the 2012/2013 Social Enterprise Performance Competition in Hungary
summary: Budapest, Hungary - NESsT and Citi Hungary announced the Blue Bird Foundation as the winner of the 2012/2013 NESsT-Citi Social Enterprise Performance Competition at the third annual Social Enterprise Day in Hungary. The organization was recognized for its social enterprise the Tit-Bit Restaurant (Ízlelo Étterem) in Szekszárd and awarded a prize of US$10,000. The competition aims to promote excellence among social enterprises belonging to the NESsT Portfolio. Based in Budapest, NESsT provides capital and business development support to enable non-profit organizations and small businesses to plan for and better manage social enterprises.
tag-1: NESsT and Citi Announce Winner of the 2012/2013 Social Enterprise Performance Competition in Hungary
tag-2: Budapest, Hungary – NESsT and Citi Hungary announced the Blue Bird Foundation as the winner of the 2012/2013 NESsT-Citi Social Enterprise Performance Competition at the third annual Social Enterprise Day in Hungary. The organization was recognized for its social enterprise the Tit-Bit Restaurant (Ízlelo Étterem) in Szekszárd and awarded a prize of US$10,000. The competition aims to promote excellence among social enterprises belonging to the NESsT Portfolio. Based in Budapest, NESsT provides capital and business development support to enable non-profit organizations and small businesses to plan for and better manage social enterprises.
tag-3: Competition applicants included organizations working with people with various disabilities, assisting marginalized social groups in order to gain employment and stimulate rural economic development and community cohesion. Among the competing social enterprises there were sheltered workshops employing people with physical or intellectual disabilities in candle and paper making, restaurants and organizations in the fields of environmental education and skill-building of at-risk youth. NESsT staff and local business advisors screened the applicants using enterprise performance and social impact as key criteria in evaluating potential success.
tag-4: Based on its 2012 performance, this year's award was presented to the Blue Bird Foundation for operating a restaurant which trains and employs people living with various disabilities and at the same time offers a nutritious dining alternative for the community. The Foundation has dual goals with the social enterprise: to increase the financial sustainability of the foundation and at the same time to showcase the colorful abilities of people with disabilities. In 2012, the Tit-Bit Restaurant had a turnover of over HUF22 million and provided stable and fair employment to 13 people living with disabilities.
tag-5: Presenting the award at the ceremony, Éva Hencz, Public Affairs Officer for Citi Hungary, said: "Through our joint program with NESsT, we have helped build nearly 90 social enterprises in Hungary since 2007. Blue Bird Foundation's Tit-Bit Restaurant is a great example of running a sustainable social enterprise that has created the resources for investing in expanding its operations and creating new jobs for disabled people who lacked job opportunities in their local community. Building sustainable social enterprises and creating jobs for marginalized people are our top priorities in the joint program with NESsT."
tag-6: "This award recognizes our colleagues with disabilities who get up early every day to turn their disadvantages into advantages through serving the communities in our town and in the neighborhood. With delivering exceptional work they are clear evidence to the world that disabilities do not mean the lack of abilities," said Andrea Mészáros, Director of Blue Bird Foundation.
tag-7: "The Tit-Bit Restaurant is an exceptional social enterprise and serves as a great model for others, because it continuously seeks opportunities to scale its social impact but never forgets about financial sustainability," said Anna Mészáros, member of NESsT's Supervisory Board.
tag-8: The Blue Bird Foundation is a member of NESsT's Scaling Portfolio and is now working on the expansion of its restaurant with a remarkable investment which will increase its capacities from 24 to 80 persons, providing employment opportunities for additional people with disabilities.
tag-9: About the Social Enterprise Day event in Hungary
tag-10: The Social Enterprise Day in Hungary is an annual event organized by NESsT and other partner organizations with the aim of increasing awareness of the power and potential of social enterprises to solve critical social problems and to create economic opportunities for marginalized communities. The event brings together leaders from social enterprise, government, philanthropy, business and the nonprofit sectors to celebrate social enterprise and to create an enabling environment that fosters social enterprise. This year's event focused on the timely opportunities that Hungary currently has to foster social enterprise building on lessons learned from the past and recent policies enacted in the EU. The day highlighted a panel of well-known speakers on social enterprise best practices in Hungary and abroad and included practical workshops on different strategic aspects of running a social enterprise. The participants had the chance to visit the Social Enterprise Marketplace where around 30 social enterprises from all over Hungary showcased and sold their products and services.
